column4: Hello. Someone is having trouble with apache2 + php4. He has libapache2-mod-php4 installed with all the deps and still php pages dont parse. Any ideaS?
what's the error message exactly?
no error message. When I try to load the php page in firefox it tells me if I want to download it. When I do, I get the php code.
what does the download dialog say that the mime type is?
php Script.
is the filename .php or .phps ?
php
look in /etc/apache2/apache2.conf
the page is: http://mrpetah.homelinux.org/
#AddType application/x-httpd-php .php
if that's commented out, uncommented it and reload apache2
did you uncomment that AddType line in apache2.conf?
its not in the apache2.conf its in the mods-enabled php4.load file, and its uncommented
odd looks different on my system.
this is from ubuntu pkgs not source?
yeah, ubuntu packages
ok i just installed the php pkg on my laptop, going to see if i can reproduce :)
hmm i didn't even have to uncomment that line; php worked right away for me.
you are right the AddType in modes-enabled/php4.conf does override (as it should)
hmm well that could be related eh?
marginally ;P
